sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词都可表示"有利的，好运的，顺利的"之意
means: favourable ： 普通用词，指预示从良好的结果中能得到明显好处，有利于达到目的。
fortunate ： 指目前已存在的成功或有利情况，或指因好运或机会带来的成功和喜悦。
happy ： 侧重指不是通过某种机会，而是凭借鉴另和选择手段而得到利益与好处。有时也指偶然得到的好处，但强调的是有利的结果。
lucky ： 多指偶然机遇中的有利或幸运情况。

sentence.Network_en: Chantal was lucky to be able to salvage her career.
sentence.Network_cn: 尚塔尔能保住她的事业算是走了运。

sentence.Network_en: I'm lucky really as I never put on weight.
sentence.Network_cn: 我很幸运，因为我的体重从来没有增加过。

sentence.Network_en: We're lucky to have such a man in our midst.
sentence.Network_cn: 在我们中间有这样一个人是我们的幸运。

phrase.cizu_name: you (或 he等) will be lucky (或 should be so lucky)

jx.jx_en_mean: used to imply in an ironic or resigned way that someone's wishes or expectations are unlikely to be fulfilled

lj.lj_ly: ‘A shirt would be nice.’ ‘You'll be lucky.’.
lj.lj_ls: “要是有一件衬衫就好了。”“不大可能吧。”。

phrase.cizu_name: lucky devil (或 lucky you, her，等)

jx.jx_en_mean: used to express envy at someone else's good fortune
jx.jx_cn_mean: 幸运的家伙（表达对别人好运的嫉妒）

encyclopedia.content: 歌手：布兰妮(britney spears）让幸运之神来祝福大家this is a story about a girl named lucky，{这是一个叫做lucky的女孩的故事}。

entry.def: You say that someone is lucky when they have something that is very desirable or when they are in a very desirable situation.

example.ex: I am luckier than most. I have a job...
example.tran: 我比大部分人幸运。我有份工作。

example.ex: I consider myself the luckiest man on the face of the Earth...
example.tran: 我认为自己是地球上最幸运的人。

entry.def: Someone who is lucky seems to always have good luck.

example.ex: Some people are born lucky aren't they?...
example.tran: 有人生来就有福气，不是吗？

example.ex: He had always been lucky at cards.
example.tran: 他打牌的手气向来很好。

entry.def: If you describe an action or experience as lucky, you mean that it was good or successful, and that it happened by chance and not as a result of planning or preparation.

example.ex: They admit they are now desperate for a lucky break...
example.tran: 他们承认现在急盼幸运之神的降临。

example.ex: He was lucky that it was only a can of beer that knocked him on the head.
example.tran: 算他命大，砸到他脑袋上的只是一罐啤酒。

entry.tran: 吉祥的；吉利的；带来（或预示）好运的
entry.def: A lucky object is something that people believe helps them to be successful.

example.ex: He did not have on his other lucky charm, a pair of green socks.
example.tran: 他没把另一件吉祥物，一双绿色的袜子，穿在脚上。

entry.def: If you say that someone will be lucky to do or get something, you mean that they are very unlikely to do or get it, and will definitely not do or get any more than that.

example.ex: You'll be lucky if you get any breakfast...
example.tran: 你能吃到早饭就已经算幸运了。

example.ex: Those remaining in work will be lucky to get the smallest of pay increases...
example.tran: 那些仍在工作的人，有那么一点点儿加薪就要算是运气了。

entry.tran: 值得庆幸；额手称庆；自认为幸运
entry.def: If you say that someone can count themselves lucky, you mean that the situation they are in or the thing that has happened to them is better than it might have been or than they might have expected.

example.ex: She counted herself lucky to get a job in one of Edinburgh's department stores...
example.tran: 能在爱丁堡一家百货公司找到工作，她觉得自己很幸运。

example.ex: At the end of two days, you may count yourself lucky that you don't have to live here.
example.tran: 两天过后，你就会庆幸自己不用住在这里。

entry.tran: （表示轻微的妒忌或惊讶）幸运的家伙
entry.def: You can use lucky in expressions such as 'Lucky you' and 'Lucky devil' when you are slightly jealous of someone else's good luck or success, or surprised at it.

example.ex: 'The thing about Mr Kemp is that he always treats me like a lady.' — 'Lucky old you.'
example.tran: “问题是，肯普先生向来把我当淑女看待。”——“你真幸运。”

entry.def: If you strike lucky or strike it lucky, you have some good luck.

example.ex: You may strike lucky and find a sympathetic and helpful clerk, but, there again, you might not.
example.tran: 走运的话，你可能赶上一位有同情心、乐于助人的职员。但话又说回来，你也可能没这运气。

entry.tran: 事不过三；第三次一定行
entry.def: If you say that it is third time lucky for someone, you mean that they have tried to do a particular thing twice before and that this time they will succeed.

example.ex: I've had two runners-up medals with Monaco and AC Milan, but I hope it will be third time lucky and I get a winners' medal with Rangers.
example.tran: 我为摩纳哥队、AC米兰队效力时两次都只拿到了亚军，但是事不过三，我希望能为流浪者队拿下一个冠军。

sentences.sentence: "considered himself lucky that the tornado missed his house"

means.word_mean: 3. tending to favor or bring good luck;

sentences.sentence: "a favorable time to ask for a raise"
"a prosperous moment to make a decision"

auth_sentence.content: People here don't realise how lucky they are.
auth_sentence.res_content: People here don't realise how lucky they are.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: People here don't realise how lucky they are.

auth_sentence.content: But Radiohead should be so lucky at this stage.
auth_sentence.res_content: But Radiohead should be so lucky at this stage.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But Radiohead should be so lucky at this stage.

auth_sentence.content: Lucky for us that it was still bloody marvellous.
auth_sentence.res_content: Lucky for us that it was still bloody marvellous.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Lucky for us that it was still bloody marvellous.

Sentence.sentence: The woman feels lucky to have got a ticket.

means.word_mean: 幸运的, 侥幸的, 吉利的

sentences.en: One lucky venture made his fortune.
sentences.cn: 一次幸运的机会使他发了财。

sentences.en: She was not lucky on marriage.
It is lucky for you that he didn't see it.
sentences.cn: 他没有看见它, 是你幸运。

jushi.english: We are opposed to counting on a lucky chance.
jushi.chinese: 我们反对单纯去碰运气。

jushi.english: One lucky venture made his fortune.
jushi.chinese: 一次幸运的机会使他发了财。

jushi.english: He's proud of being so lucky.
